thread.title: Microsoft halts PC Insider Preview builds to prepare for the Unified Update Platform
thread.title_full: Microsoft halts PC Insider Preview builds to prepare for the Unified Update Platform

posts.author: Zac Bowden
posts.title: Microsoft halts PC Insider Preview builds to prepare for the Unified Update Platform
posts.text:
Microsoft has today announced that they are temporarily halting Windows 10 PC Insider Preview build availability as they begin to switch their updating systems over from the old delivery method to the new Unified Update Platform. 

What does this mean, exactly? Well if you're an Insider and you're not running the latest Insider Preview build, you're now going to have to wait a few more days before you can download it as Microsoft is no longer offering builds on the fast and slow ring.
From the Microsoft blog post: 
UPDATE 12/2: We are getting ready to start releasing PC builds to Insiders using UUP. To prepare for this, we are going to pause all PC builds for both the Fast and Slow rings starting this evening (Friday 12/2). We will begin flighting the latest builds via UUP starting with our internal rings first then to Insiders based on each ring's promotion criteria. We're excited to be able to release builds for PC to Insiders using UUP! Mobile builds are not impacted by this.
It's unclear how long this pause in build availability will be, but considering Microsoft wants to test out their own method internally first, it could be a few days at the very least. Stick to Windows Central for more news regarding the Insider Preview.

thread.title: Microsoft announces improved support for Symlinks in Windows 10
thread.title_full: Microsoft announces improved support for Symlinks in Windows 10

posts.author: Pradeep
posts.title: Microsoft announces improved support for Symlinks in Windows 10
posts.text:
A symlink is a pointer to a file or folder located elsewhere, consumes little space and is very fast to create when compared to copying a file and its contents. Developers use symlinks referencing physical files/folders instead of duplicate copies of shared files/folders to save physical disk space, and reduce the time taken to copy/backup/deploy/clone projects. Symlinks are already supported in many operating systems like Linux, FreeBSD, OSX, etc. Even Windows started supporting symlinks from Windows Vista, but due to security requirements, users needed local admin rights and, importantly, had to run
Symlinks are already supported in many operating systems like Linux, FreeBSD, OSX, etc. Even Windows started supporting symlinks from Windows Vista, but due to security requirements, users needed local admin rights and, importantly, had to run mklink in a command-line console elevated as administrator to create/modify symlinks. Due to this restriction, Windows developers were not using symlinks and many modern cross-platform development tools works less efficiently and reliably on Windows. Microsoft is fixing this issue with Windows 10 Creators Update. Starting with Windows 10 Insiders build 14972, symlinks can be created without needing to elevate the console as administrator.
Microsoft highlighted the following reasons for including symlinks support in Windows 10,
Modern development projects are increasingly portable across operating systems Modern development tools are symlink-aware, and many are optimized for symlinks Windows developers should enjoy a development environment that is at least the equal of others Learn how to create symlinks here .

thread.title: Microsoft Surface Pro 5 specs & features update: 2-in-1 tablet could have giant 512GB internal storage; 4K capability not feasible?
thread.title_full: Microsoft Surface Pro 5 specs & features update: 2-in-1 tablet could have giant 512GB internal storage; 4K capability not feasible?

posts.title: Microsoft Surface Pro 5 specs & features update: 2-in-1 tablet could have giant 512GB internal storage; 4K capability not feasible?
posts.text:
0 Panos Panay, Corporate Vice President for Surface Computing holds the new Microsoft Surface Book i7 laptop at a live event in the Manhattan borough of New York City, October 26, 2016. Reuters/Lucas Jackson 
Recent reports suggest that that the Microsoft Surface Pro 5 will have a gigantic 512GB internal storage. This is incredible for a portable device that is not a laptop. Microsoft has never cut back on performance when it comes to its device as the Surface Pro 4 is a prime example. It’s an amazing piece of technology that comes in a light and small package. 
The heavily useful tablet, Surface Pro 4, has 16GB internal storage and can host an Intel i7 processor. Now, as per reports, Microsoft is looking to better its successor, the Surface Pro 5. Such a massive storage will most definitely attract a lot of buyers. But that’s not it. The Microsoft Surface Pro 5 will also have a much better battery performance. 
The Surface Pen is also reportedly getting a big upgrade and instead of a replaceable battery, the device will be able to charge wirelessly via a magnetic dock. The Microsoft Surface Pro 5 could be getting the USB 3.0 protocol along with the Thunderbolt 3 interface. Microsoft is in talks to add the USB Type-C ports to the upcoming device. 
Even though the Surface Pro 5 is unlikely to receive PixelSense Display upgrades, many believe a 4K resolution upgrade may be brought about by Kaby Lake native 4K video support. Instead, Microsoft may provide fingerprint scanning through the PixelSense Display, writes The Bitbag . 
Believed to be released in Spring 2017, the Microsoft Surface Pro 5 may sport the much-awaited Intel Kaby Lake processor and run on Windows 10 Redstone 3 from Microsoft. The Surface Pro 5 will come with a hefty price tag. The Surface Pro 4 basic model sold for US$899 (AU$1,210). This price went up to US$2,000 (AU$2,700), depending on the configuration. 
Stay tuned on IBT AU for more updates on Microsoft Surface Pro 5.

posts.text:
Seattle Times staff The Seattle Times 
TODAY: The Northwest Multiple Listing Service releases its monthly housing sales details; will rising mortgage rates have any impact on November’s numbers? … Biotechnology companies, including Seattle Genetics and Juno Therapeutics, present their latest research news at the four-day American Society of Hematology annual meeting in San Diego. Investors and scientists will be watching Juno to see whether it provides additional information on the two patient deaths last month that halted “Rocket” trial of a drug it calls JCAR015 for B cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia. … The Institute for Supply Management releases its service sector index for November. 
TUESDAY: The Commerce Department reports on international trade and factory orders for October. … The Labor Department releases revised third-quarter productivity data. 
WEDNESDAY: Starbucks — which announced last week that Howard Schultz would be stepping down as CEO, handing over the reins to President and COO Kevin Johnson — holds its biennial Investor Day in New York. The event, which starts at 5 a.m. Seattle time and will feature Schultz, Johnson and CFO Scott Maw, will be webcast at http://investor.starbucks.com . … The Labor Department releases its job openings and labor turnover survey for October. … The Federal Reserve reports consumer credit data for October. 
THURSDAY: Microsoft is expected to detail plans for Windows 10 virtual reality hardware at its two-day WinHEC conference in Shenzhen, China. The company in November promised relatively inexpensive, Windows-powered VR headsets built by hardware makers like HP and Lenovo, but offered few details. … The European Central Bank’s governing council meets to set monetary policy for the 19-country eurozone. thread.title: Microsoft Wins Proxy Access Vote (MSFT)
thread.title_full: Microsoft Wins Proxy Access Vote (MSFT)

posts.author: Richard Saintvilus
posts.title: Microsoft Wins Proxy Access Vote (MSFT)
posts.text:
Microsoft Wins Proxy Access Vote (MSFT) By Richard Saintvilus | December 2, 2016 — 10:39 AM EST 
Shares of Microsoft Corporation ( MSFT ) declined as much as 2.19% Thursday, reaching a session low of $58.94 on a Wall Street Journal report that shareholders voted down a proposal to alter how the company selects its directors. 
Investor advocate James McRitchie was pushing to make it easier for investors to nominate members to Microsoft's board . But the proposal, which garnered only 26% of votes, failed at the company's annual meeting . "That's worse than I thought," said McRitchie in reference to the 26% vote, according to the Journal. (See also: Microsoft Declares 39-Cent Cash Dividend .) 
Changing how the company selected its directors was one of several items McRitchie's proposal called for. He was also pushing for Microsoft to eliminate the so-called shareholder aggregation cap, which states that, in order to nominate directors on company proxy filings, it requires a maximum of 20 shareholders who can combine their investments to reach the required minimum 3% holdings. 
Given the challenge it poses to reach the 3% threshold with a small number of shareholders, McRitchie wanted Microsoft to increase the maximum number of investors who can team up. Stephen Giove, a partner at Shearman & Sterling LLP, explained that McRitchie's efforts are one example of investors prodding large companies and aiming to create a precedent for the wider corporate universe. (See also: How to Become a Corporate Board Member .) 
"The investors are going after companies who are leaders," Giove said, according to the Journal. "If they get them to turn, they may get others to turn." Giove estimated that some 45% of S&P 500 companies have adopted proxy access in recent years, reported the Journal. 
McRitchie is not giving up, however. Despite this defeat, McRitchie promises to return with another amendment at Microsoft's annual vote next year. 
Microsoft shares closed Thursday at $59.19, down 1.77%. The shares have risen 6.71% year to date, compared with a 7.20% rise in the S&P 500 ( SPX ) index. (See also: Microsoft Stock Upgraded at Goldman Sachs .) Subscribe to News To Use for the latest insights and analysis Thanks for signing up to Investopedia Insights - News to Use.

thread.title: Set your alarm: Microsoft's '12 days of deals' starts really early Monday
thread.title_full: Set your alarm: Microsoft's '12 days of deals' starts really early Monday - CNET

posts.title: Set your alarm: Microsoft's '12 days of deals' starts really early Monday
posts.text:
Enlarge Image The entry-level Surface Pro 4 will be discounted on December 8.
Photo by Microsoft It's hard to say what the best post-Black Friday sale on tech products is, but Microsoft is reprising its " 12 days of deals " sale and it once again looks promising.
It officially kicks off on Monday, December 5 at 12 a.m. PT, which is really Sunday night to folks on the west coast and early Monday morning for folks on the east coast (3 a.m. ET). For those in the middle of the country, well, you can take your pick between late night or early morning.
Like last year, each day for 12 days we'll see a new sale on select items. Here's the full list of deals, according to Microsoft's sale preview page :
Day 1 (December 5): Save up to $1,000 on select Intel PCs, with prices starting at $199. Day 2 (December 6): $199 for a Lenovo IdeaPad 110 laptop ($100 savings). Day 3 (December 7): Save up to 50 percent on select Xbox One games, now $19.99. Day 4 (December 8): Save $250 on the Surface Pro 4 with Intel Core M3 and 128GB SSD (now $649), plus a free sleeve. Day 5 (December 9): Save up to 70 percent on select Windows tablets , with prices starting at $49. Day 6 (December 10): Save up to $250 on the Windows Premium Collection PCs. Day 7 (December 11): Buy select Xbox controllers and get a $25 Microsoft Store gift code. Day 8 (December 12): Save $50 and get two free games with select Xbox One consoles , plus discounts on Xbox accessories and games. Day 9 (December 13): Get a $100 Microsoft Store gift code when you buy the HTC Vive or Oculus Rift VR headsets. Day 10 (December 14): Save up to $1,000 on select Intel-powered gaming PCs. Day 11 (December 15): Save up to 40 percent on select Dell PCs, with prices starting at $199. Day 12 (December 16): Save up to $200 on select Surface Pro 4 models, plus get a free Type Cover (up to $359 value). Each daily offer goes live at 12 a.m. PT or 3 a.m. ET, while supplies last. The deals are available on Microsoft's US and Canadian sites. There will also be some nice in-store doorbusters , kicking off with the JBL Flip 2 Bluetooth speaker for $19.99 on December 5.
Last year Microsoft marked down dozens of Windows 10 games and other programs to 10 cents, but we haven't heard about any steep discounts on software this year. We'll see if any materialize.

thread.title: Microsoft testing Gears of War 4 PC, console crossplay
thread.title_full: Microsoft testing Gears of War 4 PC, console crossplay

posts.author: Sean Ridgeley
posts.title: Microsoft testing Gears of War 4 PC, console crossplay
posts.text:
Microsoft testing Gears of War 4 PC, console crossplay Gears of War 4 PC players can try to stomp console players this weekend in Microsoft experiment Comment | Email to a Friend | Font Size: A A 
Microsoft last tested PC and Xbox shooter crossplay back in 2007 with Shadowrun. It was a horrendous disaster that saw PC players consistently stomp all over console players due to the increased precision of a mouse over a controller, but the company thinks it could be different with Gears of War 4, and so it's trying again. 
Starting now through Monday, December 5, you can access a public Versus playlist with specific settings -- Social / TDM / Dodgeball / KOTH / All maps / Squad size 5 -- that allows you to frag it up with your gaming cousins. 
Microsoft assures this is very much a test to see whether or not crossplay should be a permanent feature for the game. If the data says it's not, they'll abandon it. Either way, the company encourages as many people as possible to try it and help them find out.

thread.title: Microsoft 12 Days Of Deals: Holiday Promo Offers Discounts On Surface Pro 4, Xbox One Games, Computers And More
thread.title_full: Microsoft 12 Days Of Deals: Holiday Promo Offers Discounts On Surface Pro 4, Xbox One Games, Computers And More

posts.title: Microsoft 12 Days Of Deals: Holiday Promo Offers Discounts On Surface Pro 4, Xbox One Games, Computers And More
posts.text:
Computer Technology - How Laptops, Personal Computers And Tablets Are Changing The World Now Playing Microsoft has officially announced its annual 12 Days of Deals promotion, set to kick off on Dec. 5. The company prepared a mixed bag of offers with discounts on PCs, tablets, Xbox consoles and games, Surface and more, so here's what to expect. ( Microsoft Store ) Advertisement 
Microsoft entered the holiday mood and it just revealed its annual 12 Days of Deals promotion, offering a mixed bag of discounts on various items. 
December has just started and the holidays are still a few weeks away, but Microsoft likes to announce its big promotions ahead so that prospective shoppers have plenty of time to decide which deal they want to save up for. 
Because tech gifts are always popular during the holidays and pretty much any time of the year, Microsoft has prepared an assortment of offers with attractive discounts on tablets, PCs, Xbox and more. 
"Whether you prefer to skip the madness of Black Friday and Cyber Monday or just like to take your time buying holiday gifts, our 12 Days of Deals holiday sale has you covered," touts Microsoft. "With great savings on some of the most sought-after gifts of the season, our limited-time offers put everything they want within reach — and within budget." Microsoft 12 Days Of Deals 
First off, it's worth pointing out that many of Microsoft's deals are available both online and in physical retail stores. The deals listed as "in-store doorbuster deal," as the name itself suggests, are available only in stores. 
The 12 Days of Deals kick off on Dec. 5 and the offers will refresh each day at midnight PT. 
Without further ado, here's what Microsoft has prepared for the holidays: 
1. Day 1, Dec. 5 allows shoppers to save up to $1,000 on select Intel PCs with discounted prices starting at $199. The in-store doorbuster deal offers the JBL Flip 2 portable Bluetooth speaker at just $19.99, marking a notable discount of $50. 
2. On Day 2, Dec. 6, customers can get a Lenovo Ideapad 110 at $199, which is $100 off the regular price. For the in-store doorbuster deal, Microsoft promises the best price ever on Fitbit Blaze fitness smartwatches. 
3. On Day 3, Dec. 7, Microsoft will offer select Xbox One games for 50 percent off, at $19.99. The in-store doorbuster deal will bundle a $50 Microsoft Store gift card when making a one-year Groove Music subscription. 
4. On Day 4, Dec. 8, Microsoft will slash $250 off the Surface Pro 4 with an Intel Core m3 and a 128 GB SSD, offering the device at $649 complete with a free sleeve. The in-store doorbuster deal will see a $25 Microsoft Store gift card bundled with the purchase of a one-year Xbox Live Gold subscription. 
5. On Day 5, Dec. 9, Microsoft will shave up to 70 percent off select Windows tablets, starting at $49. The in-store doorbuster deal will offer the Lumia 650 smartphone at just $79, $120 off its regular price. 
6. On Day 6, Dec. 10, customers can get the Windows Premium Collection starting at $499, marking a $250 discount. The in-store doorbuster deal will offer Office 365 Home at the lowest price of the year. 
7. On Day 7, Dec. 11, purchasing select Xbox Wireless Controllers will get you a $25 Microsoft Store gift card or code. The in-store doorbuster deal will offer select Xbox One 500 GB consoles at $179, allowing for savings of $120. 
8. On Day 8, Dec. 12, Xbox One consoles will come with two free select games, worth $50. The in-store doorbuster deal will offer a $25 Microsoft Store gift card for the first customers in line. 
9. On Day 9, Dec. 13, purchasing a HTC VIVE or Oculus Rift headset will bundle a $100 Microsoft Store gift card or code. The in-store doorbuster deal will offer the Fitbit Charge HR at the lowest price of the year. 
10. On Day 10, Dec. 14, select gaming PCs with Intel inside will be up to $1,000 off, starting at $799. The in-store doorbuster deal will drop the price of Halo 5, Quantum Break and Forza Motorsport to $19.99. 
11. Day 11, Dec. 15, will drop up to 40 percent off select Dell PCs, starting at $199. The in-store doorbuster deal will offer the Acer Liquid Jade Primo at $299, marking a discount of $150. 
12. Lastly, on Day 12, Dec. 15, Microsoft will offer a free type cover with any Surface Pro 4 purchase, allowing for savings of up to $159.99. The in-store doorbuster deal will offer a $50 Microsoft Store gift card to the first customers in line. 
In other words, not all deals are all that exciting, but some days do offer some attractive offers. If you're still shopping for holiday gifts for yourself or a loved one, it's worth checking out what Microsoft has to offer. TAG © 2016 Tech Times, All rights reserved. thread.title: Dead Rising 4’s Launch Trailer Bring the Holiday Feels
thread.title_full: Dead Rising 4’s Launch Trailer Bring the Holiday Feels

posts.author: Jordan Biazzo
posts.title: Dead Rising 4’s Launch Trailer Bring the Holiday Feels
posts.text:
One of Microsoft’s biggest exclusives this year, Dead Rising 4 has finally received its launch trailer. It premiered last night at the Game Awards and it brought the holiday feels.
However, protagonist Frank West celebrates a little differently. The trailer shows a mix of gameplay and narration from West himself, check out the trailer down below.

Dead Rising 4 brings players back to the mall that started the franchise, William Parkview Mall. Players will once again take the role of Frank West as they experience the post-apocalyptic world 16 years later. The latest Dead Rising game acts as a soft reboot of the franchise, giving Capcom more creative freedom to push the series forward.
The game is a time exclusive for Microsoft, so PlayStation users might have to wait awhile before they get their hands on the game.
Dead Rising 4 is releasing on Dec. 6 for Xbox One and Windows PC.
The post Dead Rising 4’s Launch Trailer Bring the Holiday Feels appeared first on Gameranx .

thread.title_full: Powershelf and Hitachi Consulting Introduce New IoT Smart Retail Shelves Powered by Microsoft Azure - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

posts.author: cbs8
posts.title: Powershelf and Hitachi Consulting Introduce New IoT Smart Retail Shelves Powered by Microsoft Azure
posts.text:
New Technology Will Increase On-Shelf Availability and Generate Shopper Insights
Annapolis, MD (PRWEB) December 02, 2016
Powershelf® and Hitachi Consulting are working with Microsoft to introduce smart shelves to US retail stores. The new Powershelf smart shelf units will be installed in 15 supermarkets of a leading Midwest supermarket chain. KING’S HAWAIIAN®, America’s leading provider of Hawaiian food, will be the first to use the new smart shelves to reduce out-of-stock incidents and ensure shoppers can find its products while shopping this holiday season. By dramatically reducing the amount of time KING’S HAWAIIAN shelves are empty, the company is making customers’ shopping experiences a little less frustrating and also limiting the revenue that can potentially be lost when shelves are empty.
The units consist of a series of shelves that hold and display products. Built-in Powershelf technology tracks product availability; when a shelf is empty, a restocking alert is automatically sent to store personnel. The solution utilizes Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Power BI to analyze when, where, and why products sell so fast, allowing retailers and consumer product companies to identify trends and avoid out of stocks before they ever happen.
John Linehan, Executive Vice President of Strategy and Business Development at KING’S HAWAIIAN, was impressed with early pilot results and believes the technology will lead to better customer satisfaction and improved sales performance. “Improving out of stocks is an important strategy for KING’S HAWAIIAN, and Powershelf will give us the data to manage this metric most effectively,” said Linehan. “We look forward to expanding this technology to as many of our retailers as soon as it is practical.”
KING’S HAWAIIAN and its respective retailers and distributors will be able to access data gathered by the units—including historical out-of-stock incidents and loss of potential sales—in real-time through the Internet of Things (IoT) with a customized digital dashboard co-developed by Microsoft and Hitachi Consulting.
“We have spent years working with our partners to develop this IoT solution that helps to solve out of stocks, and I am excited to see it introduced in time for this holiday shopping season,” said Larry McWilliams Co-CEO of Powershelf. “By making more products available we are providing shoppers with a more positive shopping experience, while reducing the cost of restocking. This is a powerful first step into the future of retail.”
Brendan O'Meara, Managing Director of Worldwide Retail at Microsoft, explained why the data gathered by these units is so valuable. “Our collaboration with Powershelf enables us to leverage the Microsoft Cloud to combine a retailer’s inventory data with the data Powershelf sensors gather from the store floor and visualize it using Power BI tools,” said O’Meara. “Decision makers can use their custom dashboard to see the state of their stores and supply chains in real-time and react much faster than in the past.”
About Powershelf
Powershelf is a leading provider of retail technology solutions. The patented technology—the Powershelf system—provides constant power and two-way communications to software-enabled applications and devices that deliver a variety of advertising, merchandising and pricing services to customers. Powershelf is designed to address the critical, ongoing challenges faced by retailers and CPG manufacturers around the world. For more information, please visit http://www.IOTsmartretail.com
About Hitachi Consulting Corporation
Hitachi Consulting is the global management consulting and IT services business of Hitachi Ltd., a global technology leader and a catalyst of sustainable societal change. In that same spirit – and building on its technology heritage – Hitachi Consulting is a catalyst for positive business change, propelling companies ahead by enabling superior operational performance. Working within their existing processes and focusing on targeted functional challenges, we help our clients respond to dynamic global change with insight and agility. Our unique approach delivers measurable, sustainable business results and a better consulting experience.
About KING'S HAWAIIAN
Founded more than 60 years ago in Hilo, Hawaii, by Robert R. Taira, KING'S HAWAIIAN is a family-owned business that for three generations has been dedicated to providing irresistible, original recipe Hawaiian foods made with Aloha Spirit. A priority for the company is sharing the Hawaiian Way – a uniquely Hawaiian approach to hospitality based on graciousness, generosity, and a commitment to making everyone feel a part of the KING'S HAWAIIAN 'ohana' (extended family). KING'S HAWAIIAN makes the #1 branded dinner roll in the United States, along with other great Hawaiian foods. The company operates baking facilities in Torrance, California, and Oakwood, Georgia. For more information visit the company's website at http://www.KingsHawaiian.com , "Like" KING'S HAWAIIAN on Facebook a nd Follow KING'S HAWAIIAN on Twitter.

posts.text:
Microsoft Stores Reveal Deep Xbox Discounts and Offers for the Holidays by Will Tuttle, Xbox Wire Editor in Chief Posted on Tweet 
Microsoft Stores announced its 12 Days of Deals – the store’s annual series of incredible, one-day-only savings and doorbusters – and there are a ton of can’t-miss deals on Xbox One bundles, games, controllers and more. Savings run December 5 -16 at your local Microsoft Store and microsoftstore.com while supplies last. In-store doorbuster deals are exclusively available at brick-and-mortar locations, while supplies last. Xbox and gaming offers include: Day 3 (December 7): Save 50 percent on select Xbox One games, including Battlefield 1 , ReCore and Call of Duty Infinite Warfare . Gamers headed to their local Microsoft Store can take advantage of an In-Store Doorbuster Deal to get a $50 Microsoft Store gift card with the purchase of a 12-month subscription to Groove Music. Day 4 (December 8): When you visit your local Microsoft Store, get a $25 Microsoft Store gift card while supplies last with the purchase of a 12-month Xbox Live Gold subscription , giving you access to the fastest, most reliable gaming network, free games through the Games with Gold program, exclusive discounts on games purchased through the Xbox Store and more. Day 7 (December 11): Get a $25 Microsoft Store gift card with the purchase of select Xbox Wireless Controllers . And for those looking to take an Xbox One home too, you can save $120 on select Xbox One* bundles (500GB) at your local Microsoft Store, while supplies last. Day 8 (December 12): Save $50 and get two free select games with the purchase of select Xbox One S and Xbox One bundles . Plus, if you’re one of the first in line at your local Microsoft Store, you can also get a $25 Microsoft Store gift card. Day 9 (December 13): Get a $100 Microsoft Store gift card with the purchase of an HTC Vive or Oculus Rift , offering some very real savings on virtual reality. Want to test it before you buy? You can try HTC Vive or Oculus Rift for yourself at select Microsoft Store locations. Day 10 (December 14): Save up to $1,000 on select Intel powered gaming PCs , starting at $799. You can also get Microsoft Studios blockbuster games: Quantum Break , Halo 5: Guardians and Forza Motorsport 6 , for $19.99, as an in-store doorbuster deal at your local Microsoft Store. 
For a full list of the 12 Days of Deals offers, visit the The Fire Hose blogs. With such great savings, there’s never been a better time to visit microsoftstore.com .

thread.title_full: Microsoft Suspends Windows 10 Builds to Prepare New Windows Update System - Softpedia News

posts.title: Microsoft Suspends Windows 10 Builds to Prepare New Windows Update System - Softpedia News
posts.text: Microsoft Suspends Windows 10 Builds to Prepare New Windows Update System GO New PC builds no longer available in Fast and Slow rings Dec 3, 2016 06:52 GMT · By Bogdan Popa · Share: ​Microsoft has temporarily suspended the delivery of new Windows 10 builds to insiders enrolled in the Fast and Slow rings, as the Windows team is internally working on the new Unified Update Platform that the company announced earlier this year. Dona Sarkar, head of the Windows Insider program, said they are planning to internally test the new UUP system internally before shipping it to users who are part of the Insider program, so it’s not clear how long this is going to take. What’s important to know is that users can no longer download new builds in the Fast and Slow rings for PCs. Mobile users are not affected. “We are getting ready to start releasing PC builds to Insiders using UUP. To prepare for this, we are going to pause all PC builds for both the Fast and Slow rings starting this evening (Friday 12/2). We will begin flighting the latest builds via UUP starting with our internal rings first then to Insiders based on each ring’s promotion criteria. We’re excited to be able to release builds for PC to Insiders using UUP! Mobile builds are not impacted by this,” Dona explained. What’s UUP? For those who missed Microsoft’s original announcement on the Unified Update Platform, this is a new updating system that speeds up update checks and dramatically cuts the size of updates by only downloading the bits that you need, and not full new builds. The delivery of large OS updates would thus be significantly faster, Microsoft says, as your computer would have to get only the files that have changed since the previous version, and not a complete image of the OS. Furthermore, the update checking would be performed server-side, so it would be faster. “Because more processing is being done by the service, this will lead to faster checks for update operations. It’s important to note that with UUP, nothing will look or behave differently on the surface, UUP is all underlying platform and service optimization that happens behind the scenes,” Microsoft says. The UUP system would be tested with help from insiders in the coming months, while everyone else would get it with the Creators Update in early 2017.

thread.title: Lenovo: If You Value Your Server, Block Microsoft's November Security Update
thread.title_full: Lenovo: If You Value Your Server, Block Microsoft's November Security Update

posts.title: Lenovo: If You Value Your Server, Block Microsoft's November Security Update
posts.text: Sat Dec 03, 2016 10:21 Lenovo: If You Value Your Server, Block Microsoft's November Security Update Tweet TEHRAN (FNA)- Lenovo server admins should disable Windows Update and apply a UEFI fix to avoid Microsoft’s November security patches freezing their systems. The world’s third-largest server-maker advised the step after revealing that 19 configurations of its x M5 and M6 rack, as well as its x6 systems are susceptible. Lenovo’s machines are crashing upon installation of Microsoft's Security Update MS16-140 for Windows Server 2016, 2012 R2 and 2012, we're told. The server manufacturer warns here : "Do not install the Microsoft Windows Server 2016, 2012 R2 or 2012 November update before applying fixed UEFI firmware as specified in the 'Solution' section. Replacing the system board will not fix the issue." Lenovo has advised sysadmins to head off Microsoft's November update at the pass by turning off Windows Update. Then they should download and apply new UEFI firmware for their system on Lenovo’s list. Only then is it safe to apply Microsoft's security update, Lenovo said. The root of the problem appears to be a clash with Microsoft's software and the systems' UEFI firmware, which is used for Secure Boot. Lenovo's systems running Windows Server 2012 and 2012 R2 configured to run with secure boot are exposed to the boot-up problem. Its systems running Windows Server 2016 are exposed regardless of the secure boot configuration. The Reg asked Lenovo to identify the cause of the bug or confirm if planned to update the UEFI on future systems. It did not respond at time of writing. Microsoft would not detail the exact technical cause of the problem or say whether it planned changes to November's security update to prevent a re-occurrence of this problem. In a statement, a Microsoft spokesperson told The Reg: "Lenovo released a firmware update to address this, and we recommend customers contact Lenovo for more information.”

posts.title: Microsoft updates 3D Builder app with Windows 10 Mobile and Xbox support
posts.text:
If you're a user of the Windows 10 3D Builder app, we've got some exciting news for you. Microsoft recently updated the 3D Builder app with support for Windows 10 Mobile and Xbox One, meaning you can now design and 3d print your models from even more Windows 10 powered devices!

For those who are unfamiliar with 3D Builder, it's an app bundled with Windows 10 that allows users to create, design and share 3d models, with the built in ability of being able to 3d print them directly from within the app.
Some might say it's similar to the recently released Paint 3D app, except it's missing all the "paint" features outside of being able to build 3d models and objects. The 3D Builder app also works with Kinect, allowing you to scan in items directly within the app.

thread.title: Microsoft to use AI to automatically describe images for the blind
thread.title_full: Microsoft to use AI to automatically describe images for the blind

posts.title: Microsoft to use AI to automatically describe images for the blind
posts.text:
Microsoft to use AI to automatically describe images for the blind December 3, 2016 - 12:35   Microsoft on Friday, December 2 said that, starting in early 2017, its Word and PowerPoint applications will be able to automatically come up with descriptions of photos that users add into documents. Office 365 subscribers will see it first in Word and PowerPoint for PCs, VentureBeat reports. 
Ordinarily, if you drop a photo into PowerPoint you can type out an “Alt Text” title and description for the photo. But not everyone does that when they’re making slide decks. Then, when a blind person opens the slide deck, they won’t be able to understand what’s going on in the picture, which could make the slide or the entire deck more difficult to fully grasp. 
Microsoft wants to change that. So it’s chosen to automate the process of making Alt Text for photo, drawing on its Cognitive Services Computer Vision application programming interface (API). “Through machine learning, this service will keep improving as more people use it, saving you significant time to make media-rich presentations accessible,” John Jendrezak, accessibility lead and partner director of program management for Microsoft’s Office Engineering team, wrote in a blog post. To use this feature, you’ll simply have to right-click on a photo and select “Automatic Alt Text.” 
The technology uses a type of artificial intelligence (AI) called deep learning to recognize objects in photos and then figure out the best words to explain the photos in its entirety. From there, operating systems’ screen readers can read the captions aloud. 
Deep learning generally involves training artificial neural networks on lots of data, such as photos, and then getting the neural networks to make inferences about new data. This is a method that has caught on at Apple, Facebook, Google, and Twitter, as well as Microsoft. 
In fact, earlier this year Facebook did something similar to what Microsoft is doing. It started automatically generating captions of photos that people share so that when blind people are scrolling through the News Feed on iOS, the VoiceOver screen reader embedded in iOS can quickly read out automatically generated captions. As a result, blind people can then understand what people are talking about in the text that people include with the pictures they post, as well as the comments that users make. 
Twitter recently made it possible for users to manually write captions for images they post. While Twitter does do deep learning research, it hasn’t offered to automatically generate captions for images. 
Also in the blog post Jendrezak noted that Microsoft will be merging the separate fields for title and description. That way, he wrote, “you have no confusion about where to enter alt-text.” Currently to add that information to an image, you have to open the Format pane, choose the Size & Properties tab (in PowerPoint; if you’re using Word, the tab is called Layout & Properties), and select the Alt Text dropdown. Related links:

thread.title: Microsoft Home Hub software coming to Windows 10 in 2017
thread.title_full: Microsoft Home Hub software coming to Windows 10 in 2017

posts.author: Vigneshwar SR
posts.title: Microsoft Home Hub software coming to Windows 10 in 2017
posts.text:
Youtube Microsoft Home Hub software coming to Windows 10 in 2017 
For past few days, Microsoft is in the headline constantly for its ambitious Home Hub project, which was once thought to be a competitor for Amazon Echo and Google Home. 
As per the latest news, the Home Hub is nothing of that sort and it is a feature designed for Windows 10 specifically to make the PC’s more communal and interactive. 
According to the sources, the Home Hub is not a dedicated device, but a software on the PC without any additional hardware requirement. This feature is compatible only on Windows 10 PCs including All-In-Ones and 2-in-1’s with touch screens. This has all the feature just like Amazon Echo and Google Home with an additional screen, which make things more approachable. 
The software giant is also planning to integrate sharing features, new user interfaces, always-listening Cortana, and apps that take advantage of new APIs, to make it more compelling. Additionally, this functionality will be extended to other platforms including Android, iOS, and Windows 10 Mobile. 
Moreover, the company is also planning to manufacture All-in-Ones specifically for Home Hub with other OEMs like Lenovo and HP. However, the project has been delayed due to more refinement and improvements that need to be made to Windows 10.

thread.title: Microsoft now lets you build and print 3D objects on Windows 10 Mobile and Xbox
thread.title_full: Microsoft now lets you build and print 3D objects on Windows 10 Mobile and Xbox

posts.author: Mehedi Hassan
posts.title: Microsoft now lets you build and print 3D objects on Windows 10 Mobile and Xbox
posts.text:
One of the interesting apps in Windows 10 is the 3D Builder app which comes pre-installed with every PC running the OS. Today, Microsoft is bringing the 3D Builder app to Windows 10 on other devices — allowing users to build, design and print 3D objects right from their Windows 10 Mobile device or Xbox One console.
If you are into 3D, this app will be very useful for you as it includes all of the basic features. According to Microsoft, the app provides “everything you need to make any 3D content printable.” The app can also utilize your device’s camera to turn any real-life object into a 3D object — but the quality isn’t anything close to amazing. You can, of course, load images and turn them into 3D objects. And lastly, you can also open 3D files as the app supports 3MF, STL, OBJ, PLY, and WRL (VRML) files.
Gallery Microsoft has also teamed up with i.materialise to allow users to 3D print their creation from the 3D Builder app. Once you create something and it’s ready to be printed, you can simply click on the print button in the app and Microsoft will redirect you to i.materalise which is where you can get the creation printed and delivered to your house. And if you happen to have a 3D printer at your home, you can also directly print the 3D content from 3D Builder with your printer — but do keep in mind that only a selected number of 3D printers are supported at the moment.
If you want to go ahead and give the 3D builder app a try on your Windows 10 smartphone or Xbox One, you can download it from the link below:
WP-Appbox: 3D Builder (Free, Windows Store) →

thread.title: Microsoft's 12 Days of Deals 2016: Best Surface Pro, Xbox promos and more
thread.title_full: Microsoft's 12 Days of Deals 2016: Best Surface Pro, Xbox promos and more | Mic

posts.author: mic.com
posts.title: Microsoft's 12 Days of Deals 2016: Best Surface Pro, Xbox promos and more
posts.text:
Microsoft brought back its " 12 Days of Deals " promotion this year, offering great prices on an array of products. For 12 days — from Dec. 5 to Dec. 16 — the company will offer a unique special each day in physical locations and in U.S. and Canada online stores. The offers go live at midnight PST — or 3 a.m. EST — and continue until supplies last.
"With great savings on some of the most sought-after gifts of the season, our limited-time offers put everything they want within reach — and within budget," reads Microsoft's website . "Plus, with free shipping and free returns on every item every day, you can save even more when you shop at the Microsoft Store."
For the first time , Microsoft has revealed its deals in advance. There's a rundown of every available deal below, but the item to look out for is the Surface Pro 4 , marked down $250 on Thursday, Dec. 8.
Buy right now: Refurbished Surface Pro 4 — on sale for $549 ($90 off) Right now, Microsoft has a refurbished Surface Pro 4 with a 128 GB hard drive on sale for $549 until Dec. 3.
Surface Pro 4 Source: Richard Drew/AP Monday, Dec. 5, 2016 Shoppers can save up to $1,000 on Intel-powered PCs. Prices start at $199.
Tuesday, Dec. 6, 2016 Score a Lenovo Ideapad 110 laptop for $199, a full $100 off its usual retail price. This laptop features a 15.6-inch HD display and, according to Microsoft, an "improved hinge design allows for 180-degree action to a flat position, while a frame-less keyboard and textured palm rest promote comfortable typing."
Wednesday, Dec. 7, 2016 Select Xbox One games will be up to 50% off, retailing for $19.99. Options should include Battlefield 1 , ReCore , Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare , considering they're pictured on the website.
Thursday, Dec. 8, 2016 Here's the biggest deal of the week: The Surface Pro 4 with Intel Core m3 and 128 GB SSD will be available for $250 off the original price — at $649, down from $999.
This tablet, which was created as a laptop replacement, features a 12.3-inch PixelSense touchscreen display and comes with a Surface Pen. An added perk: the special offer comes with a free sleeve. If you're looking for other Surface Pro 4 models, then hold out for the last day (Friday, Dec. 16) when select models will be up to $200 off and you can score a free Type Cover.
Microsoft's Surface Pro 4 will be $250 off during their 2016 "12 Days of Deals" promotion. Source: Andrew Burton/Getty Images Friday, Dec. 9, 2016 Windows 10 tablets will be up to 70% off, starting as low as $49.
Saturday, Dec. 10, 2016 Devices in Microsoft's Windows Premium Collection will be on sale, with prices starting at $499. Shoppers can save up to $250 on items during this one-day special. This collection includes the HP Spectre x360, the Lenovo Yoga 910, the Dell XPS 13 and the Asus ZenBook Flip UX360.
Sunday, Dec. 11, 2016 Nab a $25 gift card when you purchase select Xbox controllers.
Monday, Dec. 12, 2016 Microsoft will have several great Xbox deals on Dec. 12. Not only can shoppers get two free games and save $50 when they buy select Xbox One consoles, but there will also be deals on Xbox accessories and games.
Get Xbox deals at Microsoft's e-store and brick and mortar store during their annual holiday sale. Source: Kevork Djansezian/Getty Images Tuesday, Dec. 13, 2016 Purchase the HTC Vive or Oculus Rift and get a $100 Microsoft Store gift code. The HTC Vive is a virtual reality system that is powered by Windows 10 and runs on a Vive-optimized Alienware platform. The Facebook-owned Oculus Rift, a virtual reality headset, lets gamers step up their playing experience.
Wednesday, Dec. 14, 2016 If you're in the market for a gaming PC, then Microsoft will have several deals. Select gaming PCs will be as low as $799, with deals up to $1,000 off.
Thursday, Dec. 15, 2016 Dell PCs will be up to 40% off with models starting at $199.
Friday, Dec. 16, 2016 Wait for the last day if you're looking to grab a Surface Pro 4 that is not a Surface Pro 4 with Intel Core m3 and 128 GB SSD — that particular model will be $250 off on Thursday, Dec. 8 and will come with a free sleeve. On Dec. 16, select models will be up to $200 and shoppers can get a free Type Cover with the purchase, which is a $359 value.

thread.title: Microsoft HoloLens comes to Japan

posts.title: Microsoft HoloLens comes to Japan
posts.text:
Microsoft HoloLens comes to Japan By Aadil Raval | Dec 02, 2016 08:59   PATRIK STOLLARZ) Sascha Froemming from Thyssenkrupp elevators looks through a hololens egineered by German steel group Thyssenkrupp, on the sidelines of a press conference on Thyssenkrupp's annual earnings on November 24, 2016 at the company's headquarters in Essen, western Germany. With the hololens service technicians can visualize technical informations in the hololens glasses during the work on elevators. / AFP / PATRIK STOLLARZ (Photo credit should read PATRIK STOLLARZ/AFP/Getty Images) 
Microsoft is set to launch the HoloLens in Japan from 02nd December. Japan became the first territory in Asia to get the Microsoft HoloLens for which the preorders will be initiated in the later weeks of December. 
Alex Kipman of Microsoft said "We Continue to be inspired by the work developers and customers are doing with HoloLens across the globe. Japan is no different". He even expressed his gratitude towards Japan Airlines which has already opted for HoloLens. Kipman said "By using HoloLens, Japan Airlines has developed two proof-of-concept programs to provide supplemental training for engine mechanics, and for flight crew trainees who want to be promoted to co-pilot status. We are very excited to have them on this holographic journey with us."A month ago in October 2016, a formal announcement was made by Microsoft to launch the HoloLens in six new territories that are Germany, New Zealand, UK, France, Australia, and U.K. However, within a year, Microsoft is hoping to make it available across the globe. Advertisement 
All About HoloLens - Back in October, Microsoft explained some of its long list of features which includes Microsoft's Edge Browser, 3D content creation tools with Windows 10 and 3D model library using which the users can pull the digital 3D object into Augmented Reality Environment produced by HoloLens. Advertisement 
Earlier in July 2016, it was reported that Independent development teams have been working on Microsoft's Augmented Reality Headset with the inclusion of the mobile game phenomenon "Pokemon Go" for which a YouTube video was published with received more than 1.8 Million hits. 
In August, Microsoft unveiled the HoloLens in North America with the price tag of whopping $3,000 which was made available for developers only. Later in October, HoloLens AR Headsets was made available in the UK for developers for which the preorder price tag is £2,719 as quoted by ITPRO . 
Mircosoft HoloLens customers are currently developing innovative solutions for improving and impact their business positively as added by PR Newswire . 
Mircosoft HoloLens AR Headset is one of the most sophisticated AR Device till date. Oculus Rift is a world-class Virtual Reality Headset which when coupled with Xbox One S , it gives thrilling and mind numbing experience. Advertisement © 2016 Mstars News, All rights reserved. posts.title: Microsoft Remote Desktop - Microsoft Corporation
posts.text: by ATL Leerssens I’ve been using CoRD for years and now that it has more or less dropped out of support and crashes frequently on El Capitan, I moved on to this app after finding it in the App Store. A few things annoy me right out of the gate, and documentation is sparse so I’m not sure if there is a way to reslove them:- With CoRD, Commnd-K integrated so that I could quickly connect to a remote server without having to do a bunch of configuation.- This version of Remote Desktop forces a new connection into Spaces, which seems to be configurable but the option to turn it off is grayed out.Other than that, cut/paste work as expected, which is huge when working with multiple OSes on different windows. Hopefully this app will get some love and improve over time. Works great by SMXSteve I’ve use the Windows version for years and have been using this on my Macbook for four years now. I love it! I can always access my servers and Windows PCs. In fact, I have one Window 7 PC which I use strictly for development. I just remote into it from my Macbook and it works flawlessly! This app needs some resources put to it by SentiBlue I know MS doesn’t pay much attention to this app but for God’s sake it’s like a high school project!There must have been over 100 updates to this app, but the top of the app has always been “My Desktops” without any ability to create groups.I’m a system architect who manages hundreds of Linux servers and dozens of windows. I find it particularly unuseful to have an app that cannot categorize.The app has a minimum width that is much wider than what I wanted it to be because of the “Azure RemoteApp” and “Remote Resources” buttons…The “New” dialog doesn’t have a button… you just fill in and hit close… that doesn’t seem like MS. Where did “Apply” and “OK” go? What if I wanted to “Cancel”?

posts.text:
Microsoft Surface Pro 4 launched by Microsoft VP Panos Panay on October 6, 2016 (Photo : Andrew Burton / Staff) Advertisement 
Tech giant Microsoft is planning to upgrade the existing model, Surface Pro 4 with Surface Pro 5 and expected to launch a new smartphone "Surface Phone" in MWC 2017. 
Microsoft Surface Pro 4, the hybrid gadget, launched in October 2015, was a big hit for Microsoft, which helped showcase its prowess in the Tech world. Like its sibling, Microsoft Surface Pro 5, is also expected to outperform in specs and features to take on its rivals head-on. 
As per Mobipicker , Microsoft Surface Pro 5 is rumored to be embedded with Intel Seventh Generation Kaby Lake processor supported by a whopping 16GB RAM. The hybrid laplet will run on the latest Windows 10 Redsotne2 to be released in 2017. Though sources indicate that display of 4K resolution is on the cards, but at least will stimulate the fans with stunning 2K resolution. 
Surface Pro 5 also believed to come up with a new Surface Pen and USB Type-C connector, bidding adieu to USB-3 of Surface Pro 4. The device is expected address the haunting battery draining issue of Surface Pro 4. The 2-in-1 hybrid device is expected to launch with a price tag of $899 for i5 model and $1599 for top end i7 model. 
Microsoft Surface Phone hints at the Surface Phone could offer stellar specs like the advanced Qualcomm® Snapdragon® 830 processor supported by 3GB/6GB/8GB RAM, which will enthrall users with high multi-tasking performance while consuming less power, giving more juice for the device. 
In an interview to the Australian Financial Review , Microsoft CEO, Satya Nadella Said "We will continue to be in the phone market not as defined by today's market leaders, but by what it is that we can uniquely do in what is the most ultimate mobile device". This indicates that Microsoft Surface Phone will be nothing short of a world-class phone. 
Microsoft threw water on fans expectations in October 2016 when devices didn't show up for a probable launch. But, both devices are highly likely to have a synchronous launch in Spring 2017. Windows fans, don't forget to keep a date for that upcoming event. Stay tuned with us for more updates!!   Related Articles

thread.title: Microsoft On Recent Xbox One Success: ‘Momentum Is Really Important In This Business’
thread.title_full: Microsoft On Recent Xbox One Success: ‘Momentum Is Really Important In This Business’

posts.author: Oliver VanDervoort
posts.title: Microsoft On Recent Xbox One Success: ‘Momentum Is Really Important In This Business’
posts.text:
While the Xbox One was once considered to be losing the console wars almost before they started, it appears Microsoft has reversed those struggles. The company had been making headway before this year, though it was slow going.
Since 2016 kicked off, Microsoft has been making up ground on Sony much quicker thanks in large part to initiatives like its backwards compatibility program. This summer, the Xbox One sold more units than Sony sold PS4s for the first time since the two consoles launched in the US.
Then Microsoft did it again. Since the launch of the Xbox One S, Microsoft has touted the Xbox One S as the best selling console in the UK. The comeback the console has made is one that Microsoft is clearly quite happy about. Company representatives appear 2016 is the tipping point and they are on more solid footing when it comes to the competition with Sony’s PS4.
“Since launch, Xbox One S is Britain’s best-selling console in 2016,” Xbox UK marketing director Harvey Eagle stated in an interview with GamesIndustry .
“I put that down to a combination of things. Firstly, it is a great product with a great design, and the 4K proposition is resonating very strongly. I think we have a great selection of console bundles for those buying for the first time – particularly with FIFA , Minecraft and Battlefield as the core three options.
“I think we have a great exclusive line-up again this year. Forza Horizon 3 is a great game and really highly rated on Metacritic, and Gears of War 4 is another great example of an exclusive game.
“And with all of that at a price point that has opened us up to being more attractive to more families than ever before.”
“Momentum is really important in this business, because it gives confidence to retailers, publishers and to consumers. We are giving them confidence that they have made a right point. I think we’ll look back on 2016 as a tipping point for Xbox One. And as I look forward to 2017, we have some really great things to look forward to that will help us sustain and build on this momentum, including games like Halo Wars 2 and Sea of Thieves, and of course a new Xbox One console in Project Scorpio.”
Thoughts on this? Let us know in the comments below.

posts.title: 25 Programs To Empower Youth In Technology From...
posts.text:
Share By Jennifer Wagner 
You know Microsoft as a giant technology company. Did you also know that it does a great deal to bridge the digital divide and try to make sure that all young people have access to the skills needed for careers in technology areas. 
Microsoft created the YouthSpark Global initiative to create opportunities for millions. After working with 350 nonprofits and creating over 30 programs, after two years, 227 million opportunities have been created by YouthSpark. 
These (mostly) online programs are for young people ranging from age 6 to 24 from around the world. And you don't have to be on the other side of the digital divide to use them. Anybody that wants to learn, can do so. You can check all the programs out on the YouthSpark Hub . Here are short summaries of 25 of them below. If you want to learn more, click on the link to the program. 
Biz Spark - Are you creating a Startup for your great new tech idea? If so, Biz Spark wants to help you with free software, tools and cloud services. 
continue reading below our video 5 Packable School Lunches All Kids Love 
Channel 9 - Learn programming with beginners video tutorials in Visual Basic, C#, HTML5 & CSS3, JavaScript and how to build apps for Windows Phone 7, 8, 8.1, JavaScript and C#. 
DigiGirlz - High school girls get the chance to learn about careers in technology from women working at Microsoft. They can also take online classes where they can learn to create their own websites and podcasts. 
DreamSpark - Verify that you are a student and get professional developer and designer software tools at no cost! 
Imagine Cup - Global student technology competition. 
IT Academy - Learn important skills and get Microsoft certified, which will help your chances of getting into the colleges or jobs that you are hoping for. 
Job Start 101 - A foundation for learning the skills employers feel most college graduates are lacking. 
Kodu Game Lab - Build video games with Microsoft's Kodu. 
Microsoft Digital Literacy - A very basic beginner course that teaches computer basics such as the Internet, cloud services, WWW, productivity programs, security and privacy and digital lifestyles. You will also be shown how to make your first app. 
Microsoft Internship Program - Apply for college internships. 
Microsoft Jobs Blog - Become a regular reader of this blog that shows you what its like to apply, interview and work at Microsoft. Get all the inside tips and see what the lifestyle looks like. 
Microsoft Local Language Program - Get access to technology in over 108 languages that respects linguistic and cultural distinctions. 
Microsoft MVP Mentors - To get advice from mentors, you can ask on Facebook or Twitter, you can attend one of Microsoft's mentoring events, or can can ask to have a one to one mentor. 
Microsoft Office Training - Online training on all Office products for the PC, Mac, Android tablet, iPad and iPhone. 
Microsoft Research - Learn about Microsoft's research by reading blog posts, watching videos, listening to podcasts and more. 
Microsoft Safety and Security Center - All the basics that you and your family should know about security and privacy on your computer. Not only will you learn all the essentials, but there are tips and FAQs to help also. 
Microsoft Virtual Academy - Free online video tutorials given by experts at Microsoft on a huge variety of topics and tech products. 
Skype in the Classroom - A wonderful program that the school or school district must approve. Read my previous post on Skype in the Classroom: Don't Let Your School Miss Out . 
Small Basic - Use this simple coding language to create apps. 
TEACH - Are you an innovative person who likes to help others. Have you ever thought about teaching. Check out TEACH and you could be on your way. 
TEALS - This is a program in which engineers come to your school to teach computer science. If you would like this for your teens, tell the school and ask other parents to to do so also. Learning computer science and programming while still in high school is a huge advantage. 
TouchDevelop - Create an app, on any device, with TouchDevelop, a touch friendly code developer. 
YouthSpark Live - Live events for youth to attend to help plan their future, focusing on jobs, tech skills and entrepreneurship. 
YouthSpark on Global Giving - Fundraise to help change the lives of youths and help them overcome barriers. 
YouthSpark Summer Camps - Learn coding, digital photography and movie making over the summer at Microsoft stores. 
Take advantage of these free programs. Whether or not your kids or teens wind up majoring in a technology area, it will still be more and more crucial to know it as time goes on.

thread.title: Microsoft Surface Pro 5 Specs Rumors: Surface Pro 4 Successor To Sport 512 GB Storage, Better Battery Life, USB-C And More
thread.title_full: Microsoft Surface Pro 5 Specs Rumors: Surface Pro 4 Successor To Sport 512 GB Storage, Better Battery Life, USB-C And More

posts.title: Microsoft Surface Pro 5 Specs Rumors: Surface Pro 4 Successor To Sport 512 GB Storage, Better Battery Life, USB-C And More
posts.text:
The Microsoft Surface Pro 5 is rumored to feature many improvements over its predecessor, the Surface Pro 4. One such improvement is that the Surface Pro 5 is said to be coming with storage of up to 512 GB. ( Microsoft ) Advertisement 
The Microsoft Surface Pro 5 is among the best upcoming tablets of 2017 , as the release of the 2-in-1 device that will be the successor to the Surface Pro 4 is long overdue. 
The rumor mill has been busy churning out reports regarding the Surface Pro 5, and the latest one reveals that the tablet will have many improvements over its predecessor. Microsoft Surface Pro 5 With 512 GB Storage 
According to recent rumors, the Surface Pro 5 will pack up to 512 GB of storage , which is double the capacity of the Surface Pro 4 with only up to 256 GB of storage. 
It has previously been expected that the Surface Pro 5 will also be released with up to 256 GB of storage, in line with the Surface Pro 4, but if this rumor turns out to be true, it seems that Microsoft is looking to take the Surface Pro 5 on an entirely new level, along with the other rumored improvements for the device. Microsoft Surface Pro 5 Improvements 
In addition to the rumored increase in storage from 256 GB to 512 GB, the Surface Pro 5 is also said to feature better overall performance, including the latest Intel Kaby Lake processor and better battery life compared with the Surface Pro 4. Its predecessor came with several battery drain issues , so this improvement would be a welcome one for fans of the device. 
There have also been rumors that Microsoft will be adding a USB Type-C port to the Surface Pro 5, which will also be including Thunderbolt 3. 
The Surface Pen is also said to be coming with improvements, with the accessory to receive wireless charging capabilities from its magnetic dock instead of the replaceable battery in the past. Microsoft Surface Pro 5 Rumors 
Microsoft is said to be releasing the Windows 10 Redstone 2 operating system in 2017, and it is possible that the Surface Pro 5 would be running it right out of the box. 
As for the device's RAM, there has so far been no news that Microsoft will be making further improvements to the 16 GB of RAM found in the Surface Pro 4. 
As for the release date of the Surface Pro 5, a specific date has not yet been determined. It is rumored that the tablet will launch in spring 2017, possibly even as early as January , with the delay in the release date due to Microsoft waiting for Intel to release the Kaby Lake processor that is expected to come out at the end of this year.

posts.title: Microsoft now lets you play video folders in the Movies and TV app
posts.text:
Microsoft has just updated the Windows 10 Movies and TV app with new features from the Windows Insider program which had previously debuted for Insiders on the Fast, Slow and Release preview iterations of the app. The new update now lets you play videos which are organised in a folder more convennently. Rather than having to exit the video and then navigate to the next one, you can now navigate easily from one video to another via the new forward and backwards buttons. Microsoft is also making it easier for you to give them your money by making it easy to re-rent expired rental movies and tv episodes, as well as pre-pay for new TV episodes if you’re on a binge – and aren’t using Netflix for some reason.
For Xbox users, Microsoft makes it easier to search the Microsoft Store movie library bu pressing the Y button on the console to search.
Here’s the changelog from the store:
On desktop and phone, when you start a video in folders view, Previous and Next now skip to other videos in that folder When rentals expire, it’s easier to rent them again Buy while you binge: You can pay for each next TV episode just before it plays On Xbox One, press Y to search Minor fixes and improvements throughout the app Download the app from the store link below:

posts.author: Ivan Jenic
posts.title: Windows 10 build 14977 fails to install on some Mobile devices
posts.text:
0 0 
Microsoft just released the new Preview build 14977 for Windows 10 Mobile . The build is currently only available for Mobile devices, so Insiders on PC will have to wait some more time to get the new build. 
As always, Microsoft revealed the list of known issues that build 14977 causes. However, problems listed by Microsoft are not the only problems bothering Insiders. Microsoft’s Jason [MS] said on Microsoft’s forums that some Lumia devices are having problems downloading the new build. 
“Hello Insiders, 
While attempting to install build 14977 for Mobile, you may hit an error: 8007007B 
Unfortunately if you hit this error, you will not be able to install 14977. There is no workaround. You’ll need to wait for our next Mobile build release. 
This issue does not affect all devices and there is no long-term harm from encountering it. The device will simply fail the install and boot back to your current OS build. 
We’re already working on a resolution so all applicable devices may receive the next update. 
Thank you as always, 
Jason” 
Microsoft is currently investigating the issue and the solution should be released soon. This is, so far, the only problem caused by build 14977 we’ve managed to find. Despite that, users are generally unsatisfied. First, the build is late on PC and even Mobile Insiders are having troubles installing it. 
As soon Microsoft releases a solution, we’ll let you know about it. Also, we’re going to write our traditional report article as soon as users report more problems. 
Have you tried to install the build on your Windows 10 Mobile device yet? Or you’ve encountered some other problems? Let us know in the comments.

thread.title: Windows 10 build 14977 now available to Insiders on Mobile only
thread.title_full: Windows 10 build 14977 now available to Insiders on Mobile only

posts.author: Ivan Jenic
posts.title: Windows 10 build 14977 now available to Insiders on Mobile only
posts.text:
0 0 
Microsoft just released the new build 14977 for Windows 10 Mobile . Unlike the majority of Windows 10 builds, this one was released for Mobile only. Reportedly, the PC release is delayed because a bug that could result in breaking apps. As soon as Microsoft resolves the issue, the build will be released for PC as well. 
The biggest highlight of Windows 10 Mobile Insider build 14977 is the introduction of an EPUB reader for Microsoft Edge. Beginning with this release, Insiders will be able to read unprotected EPUB books in their default mobile browser. This feature is already available on Windows 10 . 
The default EPUB reader also has some customization options. Users are able to change font size and themes and there are three themes available: light, sepia, and dark. 
The EPUB reader for Microsoft Edge is the only major new feature introduced with this build. Microsoft also addressed a huge number of known issues and bugs in build 14977. However, as iss normally the case, the new build also causes some issues to Insiders who install it. 
Here’s the complete list of improvements and bug fixes: “We’ve changed the rendering technology used for many types of UWP app content, so please provide feedback through the Feedback Hub if you notice any new visual glitches in UWP apps. Alarms sent by 3rd party alarm apps will now break through Cortana’s Quiet Hours – we appreciate all the app developers who logged feedback requesting this, keep it coming! We’ve removed the top-level option in Notification Settings to disable alarms on the lock screen – alarm reliability is a top priority for us, and we’ve found this setting was frequently enabled accidentally, without awareness that it would stop alarms from waking the phone when the phone was locked. For those who still wish to enable this setting, it’s will continue to be available under the per-app notification settings. Notifications from Settings can now be customized or disabled – option is available under Settings > System > Notifications > Settings We have enabled OAuth support for Yahoo Mail accounts. This will improve sync reliability for those accounts, and provide a secure experience while browsing your email. We fixed an issue where disconnecting and reconnecting a wired headset while watching a video might result the audio no longer working. We fixed an issue Insiders may have experienced where certain music apps would unexpectedly stop playing music after a single song. We fixed an issue where closing a tab in Microsoft Edge, exiting the app, and then relaunching it would sometimes result in Edge opening to a blank page with the closed tab’s web address in the URL bar. We fixed an issue where the Start Settings page wasn’t rendering when opened on external screen while using Continuum. We’ve made a number of translation improvements, including, for French (France and Canada) speakers, fixing a grammatical error in the “Don’t Forget!” text seen when shutting down the phone so it now says “N’oubliez pas”, and for Chinese speakers, fixing an issue where the option to clear the Chinese Input Method Editor’s input history was displaying in English rather than Chinese. If you see any other translations that aren’t as you’d expect, please log feedback – we’re listening! We fixed an issue where, if the setting to show notifications above lock had been turned off, booting the device and immediately checking the Action Center while the phone was locked could result in the Action Center not displaying any notifications after the phone had been unlocked. We fixed an issue Insiders may have experienced where the Camera app might not appear after using the hardware camera button while the screen was off or while on the Glance screen. We fixed an issue where Bangla (Bangladesh) keyboard text prediction might stop working after entering character followed by a vowel mark.” 
Here’s the complete list of known issues in Windows 10 build 14977: “Please avoid attempting to install new languages, keyboards, and speech packs on your phone. There is a chance these downloads may get stuck and not finish downloading. If you have existing languages, keyboards, and speech packs installed – they will carry over when you update to new builds. You can use Windows Device Recovery Tool to go back to Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows 10 Mobile, install any languages, keyboards, and speech packs you need and then update to the latest build in the Fast ring as a workaround. Windows 10 phones with 8GB of internal storage such as the Lumia 550 will likely receive an 0x800700b7 error when attempting to update to this build. For more details, head over to this forum post. System related notification toasts (e.g. Bluetooth, USB/Autoplay, etc.) do not work.” 
As for the PC release, we don’t know when will Microsoft introduce it nor if it will bring any new features. As soon as we have more information, we’ll make sure to let keep you updated. 
In case you’ve already installed build 14977 on your Windows 10 Mobile device, let us know about your experience using it so far.

thread.title: Microsoft gives Office 365 users until March 1 to cut their OneDrive storage
thread.title_full: Microsoft gives Office 365 users until March 1 to cut their OneDrive storage

posts.author: Jay Decenella
posts.title: Microsoft gives Office 365 users until March 1 to cut their OneDrive storage
posts.text:
0 0 
Microsoft seems to have started giving Office 365 users a notice that their unlimited OneDrive storage will revert back to 1TB beginning on March 1, 2017. Blogger Paul Thurrott posted on Twitter what he claimed to be a screenshot of said notice shared by a reader of his blog. 
The software giant announced the unlimited OneDrive storage offering for all subscribers of both the consumer and business version of Office 365 in October 2014. Prior to that, Office 365 users only got a maximum of 1TB storage on Microsoft’s cloud-based offering. But in November of last year, the Redmond company retracted its promise due to what it described as an abuse on the part of consumers who used the service for limitless storage. 
Microsoft lamented then that premium users had used OneDrive as a backup for PCs and huge collections of movies. To stem the supposed abuse, Microsoft decided to scale the unlimited storage offering back to just 1TB and replace the 100GB and 200GB premium plans with a 50GB plan at $1.99 per month. 
Part of backtrack is also the removal of the 15GB bonus for saving camera roll in OneDrive. Then Microsoft gave Office 365 users a one-year grace period to keep their storage beyond 1TB. Come March 1 of next year, users will have to cut back to below 1TB. Many users unhappy with the backtrack 
Although many expected the scale-back to come one day, not everyone will surely welcome the move. Some users find it “pathetic” that Microsoft should retract its promise to all subscribers just because of the perceived abuse by a few users. Others believe Microsoft should never have made the announcement to begin with, knowing that consumers would take the company’s word for it and use the unlimited storage. 
Once the backtrack takes effect, OneDrive users will need to back up their data somewhere else, though they will receive pro-rated refund. Read also:

thread.title: Next Generation Communications Week in Review: Microsoft, Nokia, Pareteum
thread.title_full: Next Generation Communications Week in Review: Microsoft, Nokia, Pareteum

posts.title: Next Generation Communications Week in Review: Microsoft, Nokia, Pareteum
posts.text:
Next Generation Communications Week in Review: Microsoft, Nokia, Pareteum December 03, 2016 By Paula Bernier , Executive Editor, TMC 
Nokia ( News - Alert ) and Pareteum made headlines this week in Next Generation Communications news. 
As contributing writer Steve Anderson explained in a piece posted yesterday, Nokia – which once led the way in the cell phone market – is making another significant push to expand its presence in this important space via a new agreement with HMD Global Oy . That entails various transactions between Foxconn Technology Group, HMD, and Microsoft ( News - Alert ) that allow HMD to be the new home of Nokia devices for the next decade. 
“We've been overwhelmed by the enthusiasm shown around the world for the return of the Nokia brand to smartphones,” said Nokia Technologies' interim president Brad Rodriguez. “The HMD Global team has the ambition, talent, and resources to bring a new generation of Nokia branded phones to market, and we wish them every success. I'm sure our millions of Nokia fans will be excited to see their new products!” 
The smartphone arena as a whole is something of a mixed bag, as Anderson wrote in a different piece this week. He noted IDC ( News - Alert ) data showing that smartphone shipments were up .6 percent this year, but noted that’s much slower growth from the previous years, when shipments were up 10.4 percent between 2014 and 2015. Nonetheless, it should be noted that this year more than one billion smartphones will ship, according to IDC, so this remains an enormous market. 
Anderson this week also wrote about the new demand for test equipment that coming 5G networks are expected to create. And, in a separate story, he talked about Nokia’s efforts in Scandanavia . That includes the company’s work on fixed broadband in Denmark and its collaboration with Finnish operator Elisa ( News - Alert ) on mobile voice services indoors and out. 
As for Pareteum , I talked to the company at the recent TMC ( News - Alert ) Editors’ Day in Santa Clara, Calif. There, the company’s CEO, Vic Bozzo, told me about the company’s work in the Internet of Things. The company, formerly called Elephant Talk, provides mobile virtual network operators and mobile network operators with cloud-based mobile communications infrastructure, operating software, and managed services.

thread.title: Xbox Games With Gold December 2016 list, news: Microsoft announces four new games free for this month
thread.title_full: Xbox Games With Gold December 2016 list, news: Microsoft announces four new games free for this month

posts.title: Xbox Games With Gold December 2016 list, news: Microsoft announces four new games free for this month
posts.text:
(YouTube/Xbox) Inset is a gameplay screenshot of "Sleeping Dogs" from Xbox's announcement of Xbox Games With Gold December 2016 free games. 
Before November ended, Microsoft announced four new free games - two each for Xbox One and Xbox 360 players - which can be played for the rest of the holiday season. 
For the whole month of December, Xbox One players with Games With Gold membership can access "Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition" for free. The main game was originally released in 2012. It is an open world action-adventure game developed by United Front Games and Square Enix where players get to control the Chinese-American main character named Wei Shen. 
Wei is a police officer who needs to go undercover to infiltrate an infamously renowned criminal organization called the Sun On Yee Triad. The Definitive Edition, which comes free this month, is the remastered version of the game for Xbox One. 
The survival horror game "Outlast" goes up for free on Xbox One from Dec. 16 to Jan. 15. The game is played in first-person mode and lets players assume the character of an investigative journalist named Miles Upshur. Advertisement 
What separates "Outlast" from other survival horror games is the fact that players have no access to weapons. Miles' only options are to run and hide from the creepy elements that reside in the asylum he decided to investigate. 
On the other hand, Xbox 360 players can access the two-dimensional platform game "Outland" from the 1st of December until Dec. 15. In the game, players will use weapons made up of Light and Dark energies which are characterized as rays of blue and red, respectively. Meanwhile, on Dec. 16 through the end of the year, the 2008-released racing video game title "Burnout Paradise" will be accessible for free. 
Xbox One players can access the free Xbox 360 titles through the Backward Compatibility program. 
Xbox Live programming head Larry "Major Nelson" Hryb reminds Xbox players: "Titles are available as free downloads for qualifying Xbox Live Gold members in all markets where Xbox Live is available. Some regions may offer different titles depending on market availability." Copyright © 2016 Ecumenical News
